summary: The Battle of Cannae in 216 BC was a big loss for the Roman Republic against Carthage. Led by Hannibal, the Carthaginians tricked and destroyed a larger Roman army. This is considered one of the worst Roman defeats and one of the greatest military tactics ever. Almost 71,000 Romans were killed. After the battle, some Italian cities switched sides to Carthage. Rome was scared and took extreme measures, even sacrificing people to their gods. Despite the huge loss, Rome kept fighting for 14 more years until they won. Cannae is now famous for how completely Hannibal defeated the Romans.
title: Battle of Cannae
